For more awesome drywall art, check out  Drywall Nation  and  Artistic Drywall By Bernie Mitchell .

Certainly impressive; however, while I don't know what exactly he's using to sculpt with, this is art ON drywall perhaps, but certainly is not "art out of drywall". Plaster/spackle bas-relief would be a more accurate term. Words mean something, although less and less lately.

Its lath/plaster it was used in homes up until 1950s; thats when drywall was discovered. Lath/plaster is still being used in European countries instead of the drywall. Thats how this artwork is made when the walls go up they are wet and it could be molded. Thats how he makes them and thats how it becomes part of the wall when it's fully dry.

Beautiful work!  My dad did some amazing work with mixing colored drywall compound in layers; the colors would change as the sections were sanded.  This effect gave a multi-colored relief on the wall; very cool!
Who gives a shit what it's called? It's beautiful and he's way more talented then 99% of the people bitching about the terminology of what it's made out of.
Actually what he's doing is using taping compound to sculpt figures on to a sheet of drywall...which is his alternative to using a canvas. Aside from that what he does is phenomenal!

There is a huge difference between drywall and plaster or spackle. Drywall is a 4x8 foot sheet of fire retardant material, synonymous with sheet rock, put up over a stick (2x4) frame to help slow a fire. Plaster or spackle is used on drywall (amongst o ... See More

description: This little pint-sized cutie is here to brighten a rainy day! Rico is a 10-pound Maltese mix who is 8 years old... a spring chicken for a small dog!  :)  Here is what  Asheville Humane Society 's volunteer groomer, Sharon, had to say about him:      "Rico came to us very matted and covered in fleas, so I had to give him a short haircut. His fleas are gone now and he feels much better! He is a very sweet ... , friendly dog that seems to love people. He was very cooperative for grooming and bathing and loved to snuggle while I was drying him. We took a walk in the courtyard and he walked nicely on leash. I think he's a total sweetie! Please remember that Rico will need regular grooming for his whole life. His hair grows just like human hair and needs to be trimmed and brushed to keep his skin and coat healthy. Rico would make a wonderful companion!"  <3   See More Letitia McGhin McKibbon

What is not being told is that this had to happen- the Government shut down near all funding for elder care, saying that families need to care for the elderly no matter the needs. Even if there is no family left, or special medical needs, does not matt ... See More

AS a daughter of a woman in an elder care facility, I have to say I am  not familiar with the Dutch process. However, it seems like a viable alternative to not only save money, but help the elderly who I know first hand experience profound loneliness. It could take some of the burden off of the family members to fill the void.

Wonderful idea!! A great program for all involved, especially the older folks who often don't have family or friends to visit them!! When my Mom was in a nursing home, we all went to visit her frequently, but her roommate wasn't so lucky so we sort of  ... See More
This would be such a great thing. If you've ever had a family member in a nursing home, you can relate to how sad it is. This is a win, win for all.

I work with seniors, and they LOOOVVVEEE having younger adults and children around. The senior center I work at is currently in the process of bringing in younger adults to join lunch, music preformances by local high schools, and a bunch of other acti ... See More

Community living... community schools... all ages working at the level of their ability to learn... tutoring each other at the level that they have completed... senior centers and day care for children with combined areas so that they interact if they choose... community in. Life can enrich all
This is not a very realistic view on how elderly people commonly life in the Netherlands. In this case there is nothing to learn from the Dutch, except how to not treat your elderly citizens.
I was volunteer caregiver at the home for the aged few years ago. Elderly people are very lonely. Keep & Love your Parents, they didnt deserve to be alone.

What a great and amazing idea. Let's find a way to start something like that here in the United States. It will help college students with their exorbitant fees and hopefully  give the seniors a way to alleviate the loneliness and boredom.

Hmmm I live in the Netherlands close to a home for the elderly. I also have quite some friends that work in those homes but never have I seen this. There's no place for students, those homes are packed with lonely people. There are huge problems with h ... See More

Darrell Mennie at first glance you claim that the Dutch shut down all senior services seems straight up wrong since the Dutch are Socialist for the most part I am sure I can search and get back to u, after football ofcourse

I think it's wonderful concept. Not every senior has a caring family, or any family, for that matter. I'll never forget my little angel coming to visit!

Oh my!!! I always see a red bird when I walk on the bi-centennial trail in the evening. Well, last week I was praying to God, praying for my friend Myra whose sister is in a coma, praying for my kids& praying for this election with my whole heart. Out  ... See More

After a very hard night at work, I went to get in my car and a Cardinal lands on my windshield. That bird just sat there for a few mins looking at me. Now, I don't believe our loved ones come back as birds to visit us but I do believe God is the maker of all creatures and he sent that red cardinal to let me know he's still in control. It was a sweet moment.

Last week on the day of JoyAnn's birthday, I pulled in my drive and about 4 or 5 redbirds flew out of the bush by the house.  It Just brought a big smile to me as I thought about angels being near to share our special day.   :)

This cardinal got in our house the day they were installing hardwood in the areas we had carpet.  I believe now it was my Mom telling me how much dog hair shows on hard wood.   üòä . But I believe she was there as a reminder she's with me everyday!

You only have to buy ONE bottle of wine valued at $15 or more and send it to ONE secret wine lover and afterwords you will receive from 6 to 36 wine bottles in return!! Comment below if you're in & I'll send you the details via fb messenger or text - if they are confusing at all, please let me know!!  This is real! comments.content: My dear mother loved Redbirds. I was devastated when she passed away. More than I can ever explain.. and more and more as time passes. It seems odd, you would think that it would get easier, but it only gets harder.
So many times I will be thinking of my Mom, who passed away two years ago, and a Cardinal will appear. Nice knowing she is still with me in spirit!!!

Oh My! Every morning I look out my door I see a Red Bird. Thank God! For his Angels watching over me. & Money always come to me when I see them. I can't say how much. But, I always Receive some. & This is True! I'm BLESSED!

I was thinking about my son James Tuesday morning and went outside just to see if a red bird was in my yard and sure enough there was one. I know he is still with me and it gives me more comfort than anyone will ever know.
Clara, Don't you know that my mom's favorite bird is CARDINAL.....She believed the bird brings a good luck and blessing to the family. I have a display Cardinal belonging to my mom.

During my wedding ceremony, something caught my eye in the trees behind my wife. It was a cardinal. My grandparents on my mom's side all loved birds, especially my Pop Pop. I was happy he was able to stop by. It meant a lot.

I have always called Cardinals my blessing when I see them on my porch or in the backyard and I am so happy to associate them with loved ones visiting me. My friends and grandchildren look for them also and now consider them family members reaching out to us when they appear.

So true. My mom loved cardinals and they come around me all the time. Even had a nest in my fern on my deck and mama bird let me experience the entire process from building the nest tthrough watching the last baby fly away. I have over 200 pics of that blessed spring event.

My mom passed a year ago and as I awoke this morning, sat in the recliner with my coffee I hear a chirping out the window. As I turned to look there was a beautiful baby cardinal. I get on FB to read new posts and within minutes I see this video. There is definitely an Angel watching over me and that is my mother.  Today will be a great day.
